benchmark_details.name: AXBENCH
benchmark_details.overview: AXBENCH is a benchmark for evaluating language model control methods at scale using synthetic data. It assesses various steering methods and concept detection with labeled data generated from an LLM.
benchmark_details.data_type: labelled pairs of instructions and responses

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of AXBENCH is to provide a comprehensive means for evaluating steering and concept detection methods in language models.

data.source: Synthetic data generated from language model prompts
data.annotation: Labelled pairs of instructions and responses generated by LLM

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model performance in concept detection and steering tasks using labeled data.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in accurately detecting concepts and steering the language model behavior.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated using a diverse set of prompts and evaluations against established models.
